p: The antihyperglycemic activity of P. curviflorus and its nanoparticle suspension formulation was evaluated in high-fat diet/streptozocin diabetic rats. The total extracts of P. curviflorus, as well as the solid lipid nanoparticle (SLN) formulations, exhibited a significant lowering in blood glucose and insulin resistance, associated at least partly with antioxidant effects, in the diabetic rats and their SLN formulations [ 47].
